steps.description: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
In a large pan, sauté the diced onion and garlic until soft.
Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in the tomato paste, diced tomatoes, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Simmer the sauce for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti.
Wash and chop the romaine lettuce into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, croutons, and parmesan cheese.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and lemon juice.
Toss everything together until evenly coated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, then serve.
Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized cubes.
Heat the olive oil in a pan and sauté the onion and garlic until softened.
Add the curry powder and cook for another minute.
Add the chicken cubes and cook until browned.
Pour in the coconut milk, season with salt and pepper, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Top with mozzarella cheese and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake in the oven for 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden.
Top with fresh basil leaves and a pinch of salt before serving.
Chop the vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Heat the sesame oil in a wok over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the broccoli, bell pepper, and carrot, and stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Pour in the soy sauce, season with salt and pepper, and stir for another 3 minutes.
Serve hot as a side dish or with rice.
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Cream the butter and brown sugar together in a bowl.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, mix the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix well.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Scoop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
